translations.sentence: Mo kò ń mú omi tí ó ra wá sí ilé.
translations.translation: I am not bringing the water that he/she bought to the house.

translations.sentence: Ìsọ̀rọ̀ ni mo ń ṣe tí ó ní ilé.
translations.translation: Talking is what I am doing that has a house.

translations.sentence: Bí mo bá ń ra aṣọ, mo máa wọ́ tí ó lọ sí ọjà.
translations.translation: If I am buying clothes, I’ll wear what went to the market.

translations.sentence: Ó ń sọ Yorùbá tí mo kọ́ wá fún ọ.
translations.translation: He/she is speaking the Yoruba that I learned and came for you with.

translations.sentence: Mo ń kọ́ létà tí ó wọ́ aṣọ lọ sí ilé.
translations.translation: I am writing the letter that he/she wore clothes and went to the house with.

translations.sentence: Wọ́n ń mú omi tí mo fún ọ wá sí ọjà.
translations.translation: They are bringing the water that I gave you to the market.

translations.sentence: Ọmọ tí mo ń rí lọ sí ilé tí ó ní bàtà.
translations.translation: The child that I am seeing went to the house that has a shoe.

translations.sentence: Mo ń ra bàtà tí ó kọ́ létà wá sí ọjà.
translations.translation: I am buying the shoe that he/she wrote a letter and brought to the market.

translations.sentence: Ó kò ń pàdé ọmọ tí mo wọ́ aṣọ fún lọ.
translations.translation: He/she isn’t meeting the child that I wore clothes for and went.

translations.sentence: Mo ń mú aṣọ tí ó ní ilé wá fún ọmọ.
translations.translation: I am bringing the clothes that have a house for the child.

translations.sentence: Ọmọ mẹ́rìndínlógún wà ní ọjà tí mo ń ra omi.
translations.translation: Fifteen children are at the market that I am buying water from.

translations.sentence: Bí mo bá ń sọ Yorùbá, mo máa wà nílé tí ó ní aṣọ.
translations.translation: If I am speaking Yoruba, I’ll stay at the house that has clothes.

translations.sentence: Ó ń gbádùn oúnjẹ tí mo ń lọ sí ọjà ra.
translations.translation: He/she is enjoying the food that I am going to the market and buying.

translations.sentence: Ó sọ pé kí mo lọ tí mo bá rí ọ.
translations.translation: He said that I should go when I see you.

translations.sentence: Mo ni mo ń wọ́ aṣọ tí ó mú wá tí mo lọ sí ọjà.
translations.translation: It’s me who is wearing the clothes that he/she brought that I went to the market with.

translations.sentence: Ó kò ń mú omi tí mo fún ọ tí mo lọ sí ilé.
translations.translation: He/she isn’t bringing the water that I gave you that I went to the house with.

translations.sentence: Ìlọ́ ni mo ń ṣe tí ó ní ọmọ tí mo ra aṣọ.
translations.translation: Going is what I am doing that has a child that I bought clothes for.

translations.sentence: Bí mo bá ń ra aṣọ tí ó lọ sí ọjà, mo máa wọ́ tí ó wá.
translations.translation: If I am buying clothes that went to the market, I’ll wear what came.

translations.sentence: Ó ń sọ Yorùbá tí mo kọ́ wá tí mo fún ọ.
translations.translation: He/she is speaking the Yoruba that I learned and came with that I gave you.

translations.sentence: Mo ń kọ́ létà tí ó wọ́ aṣọ tí mo lọ sí ọjà wá.
translations.translation: I am writing the letter that he/she wore clothes with that I went to the market and came with.

translations.sentence: Wọ́n ń mú omi tí mo ra tí mo lọ sí ilé fún ọmọ.
translations.translation: They are bringing the water that I bought that I went to the house with for the child.

translations.sentence: Ọmọ tí mo ń rí wọ́ aṣọ tí ó ní ilé tí mo lọ sí.
translations.translation: The child that I am seeing is wearing the clothes that have a house that I went to.

translations.sentence: Mo ń ra bàtà tí ó kọ́ létà wá tí mo fún ọ sí ọjà.
translations.translation: I am buying the shoe that he/she wrote a letter and brought with that I gave you to the market.

translations.sentence: Ó kò ń pàdé ọmọ tí mo wọ́ aṣọ tí mo lọ sí ilé fún.
translations.translation: He/she isn’t meeting the child that I wore clothes with that I went to the house for.

translations.sentence: Mo ń mú aṣọ tí ó ní ilé tí mo lọ sí tí mo ra omi.
translations.translation: I am bringing the clothes that have a house that I went to that I bought water from.

translations.sentence: Ọmọ mẹ́rìndínlógún wà ní ọjà tí mo ń ra omi tí mo lọ sí ilé.
translations.translation: Fifteen children are at the market that I am buying water from that I went to the house with.

translations.sentence: Bí mo bá ń sọ Yorùbá tí ó wà nílé, mo máa wọ́ aṣọ tí ó ra.
translations.translation: If I am speaking the Yoruba that is at home, I’ll wear the clothes that he/she bought.

translations.sentence: Ó ń gbádùn oúnjẹ tí mo ń lọ sí ọjà tí ó ní ilé ra.
translations.translation: He/she is enjoying the food that I am going to the market that has a house and buying.
